meanings.definition: Paying attention to or taking care of something.
meanings.sent1: The minding cat watched over her kittens with care.
meanings.sent2: She is a minding friend who always listens when you talk.
meanings.sent3: The minding squirrel made sure to hide its nuts in a safe place.
meanings.sent4: The minding gardener nurtured the plants as if they were her children.
meanings.sent5: The minding lifeguard kept a close eye on the swimmers in the pool.

meanings.sent1: He took a minding approach when crossing the busy street.
meanings.sent2: The minding driver always obeys the traffic rules.
meanings.sent3: The minding student double-checked his answers before handing in the test.
meanings.sent4: The minding explorer cautiously stepped through the dark cave.
meanings.sent5: The minding hiker packed extra supplies for the challenging trail.

meanings.sent1: She was minding her promise to call her friend back.
meanings.sent2: He kept minding the important date on his calendar.
meanings.sent3: The minding professor never forgot a student's name.
meanings.sent4: The minding historian carefully preserved the ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent5: Minding the recipe, she added the secret ingredient to the dish.

meanings.definition: Being bothered or annoyed by something.
meanings.sent1: The minding bee buzzed around, irritating everyone in the garden.
meanings.sent2: She felt minding about the loud noise coming from the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The minding child couldn't stand the itchy tag on his shirt.
meanings.sent4: The minding dog barked at the mailman every morning.
meanings.sent5: The minding neighbor complained about the bright streetlight outside.
